instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no external display on thunderbolt
threads.message:
Hi,
i have this board without external display. it work well on the internal display, but my customer need to work on external display. No liquid, very clean board.
i have <SIGNAL>PP3V3_TBTLC</SIGNAL> = 1,1V, where is generated this power supply, on <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>?
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no external display on thunderbolt
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_TBTLC</SIGNAL>  comes out from <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>.

Do you get correct voltage at L3200?
<SIGNAL>TBT_A_HPD</SIGNAL> goes high (3V)?
If yes, check <SIGNAL>DP_TBTPA_HPD</SIGNAL>.
<CHIP>U3220</CHIP> is a possible suspect...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no external display on thunderbolt
threads.message:
Ok thanks
i change <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>, the problem is solved.
